name: Joe's Pizza
description: The quintessential NYC slice. Skaters have been refueling here between sessions since the '70s. Cash only, no nonsense.
skaterRelevance: Steps from the West 4th courts and multiple downtown spots. The post-session slice.

name: Vanessa's Dumplings
description: Four dumplings for a dollar. The best fuel-to-dollar ratio in Manhattan. A skater's best friend when you're broke and hungry.
skaterRelevance: LES is a skate corridor — this is the cheapest refuel in the area.

name: L&B Spumoni Gardens
description: Sicilian slices and spumoni ice cream in Gravesend. A detour worth making — legendary square pizza with the sauce on top.
skaterRelevance: Near the southern Brooklyn spots. Perfect for a day trip session + food run.

name: Taqueria Diana
description: East Village taco spot with $2 tacos that hit different after a session. Quick, cheap, and actually good.
skaterRelevance: Right in the East Village skate zone, walkable from Tompkins and multiple street spots.

name: Los Tacos No.1
description: Chelsea Market's crown jewel. Adobo chicken and cactus tacos on fresh tortillas. Worth the line.
skaterRelevance: Chelsea Piers and the West Side Highway spots are a short skate away.

name: The Halal Guys
address: W 53rd St & 6th Ave, New York, NY 10019
description: The original cart on 53rd & 6th. Chicken and rice with white sauce — the ultimate late-night refuel after a Midtown session.
skaterRelevance: Midtown has more skateable ledges and plazas than people realize. This is the reward.
